actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1052.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 1052 â€” "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2799) to make reforms to the capital markets of the United States, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7511) to require the Secretary of Homeland Security to take into custody aliens who have been charged in the United States with theft, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of March 6.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Mike Ezell to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
